name: John STOKES, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION PAROLE; Frank Gillis, Superintendent, SCI Coal Township, et. al., Appellees
name_abbreviation: Stokes v. Pennsylvania Board of Probation Parole

parties: John STOKES, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION PAROLE; Frank Gillis, Superintendent, SCI Coal Township, et. al., Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
Motion to Dismiss for Mootness
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 8th day of October, 2003, the Commonwealth’s motion to dismiss is granted, and this matter is dismissed for mootness since no case or controversy currently exists. See Pap’s A.M. v. City of Erie, 571 Pa. 375, 812 A.2d 591, 600 (2002).
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
838 A.2d 564
John STOKES, Appellant v. PENNSYLVANIA BOARD OF PROBATION PAROLE; Frank Gillis, Superintendent, SCI Coal Township, et. al., Appellees.
No. 114 MAP 2002.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Oct. 8, 2003.
